Matthew Perry is a talented American-Canadian actor and comedian, best known for his iconic role as Chandler Bing on the hit NBC sitcom Friends (1994-2004). Born on August 19, 1969, in Williamstown, Massachusetts, Perry grew up in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.

Perry began his acting career in the early 1980s, appearing in various stage productions and television shows. He made his film debut in the 1988 comedy film "A Night in the Life of Jimmy Reardon." In the early 1990s, he landed a recurring role on the NBC sitcom "The Wonder Years" and made guest appearances on several TV shows.

The breakthrough came in 1994 when Perry was cast as Chandler Bing on Friends, a role that would cement his status as a comedy legend. Throughout the show's 10-season run, Perry's witty one-liners, clever comebacks, and lovable awkwardness earned him multiple award nominations, including two Emmy Awards.

In addition to his work on Friends, Perry has appeared in several films, including "Fools Rush In" (1997), "Almost Heroes" (1998), "The Whole Nine Yards" (2000), and "17 Again" (2009). He has also had recurring roles on TV shows like "Mr. Sunshine" (2011) and "Go On" (2012-2013).

Perry has been open about his struggles with addiction and has used his platform to raise awareness and support for related causes. In 2018, he made his directorial debut with the comedy film "The Kennedys After Camelot," which premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival.

Throughout his career, Perry has received numerous awards and nominations, including multiple Golden Globe and People's Choice Awards. He has also been recognized for his philanthropic work, particularly in the area of addiction recovery.

Today, Matthew Perry continues to act, write, and direct, leaving an indelible mark on the world of comedy and entertainment.
